definition[0]: to finally agree on something or get something after trying very hard
example[0]: a young salesman eager to clinch the deal
example[1]: A last-minute touchdown clinched the game.
definition[1]: if two people clinch, they hold each other’s arms tightly, especially when fighting
definition[2]: a situation in which two people hold each other’s arms tightly, especially when they are fighting
definition[3]: a situation in which two people who love each other hold each other tightly
definition[4]: to finally succeed in getting or winning something
example[2]: Advertising creates the interest, but personal selling clinches the deal.
